questions.question: What is the Lightning Network?

options.b: A Layer 2 payment network built on top of Bitcoin

questions.explanation: The Lightning Network is a Layer 2 scaling solution that enables fast, cheap Bitcoin payments through off-chain payment channels.

questions.question: What is a Lightning payment channel?

options.a: A direct connection between two Lightning nodes
options.b: A type of Bitcoin address

questions.explanation: A payment channel is a direct connection between two Lightning nodes that allows them to transact without broadcasting every payment to the Bitcoin blockchain.

questions.question: How are Lightning Network transactions different from regular Bitcoin transactions?

options.b: They don't require confirmation on the Bitcoin blockchain for each payment
options.d: They can only send small amounts

questions.explanation: Lightning transactions happen off-chain between channel partners, only requiring blockchain confirmation when opening or closing channels.

questions.question: What is routing in the Lightning Network?

options.b: Finding a path of channels to send payments to someone you don't have a direct channel with

questions.explanation: Routing allows payments to reach any node on the network by finding a path through interconnected payment channels.

questions.question: What is channel liquidity in Lightning Network?

options.b: The amount of bitcoin available to send in each direction of a channel
options.c: The number of channels a node has

questions.explanation: Channel liquidity refers to the balance distribution in a channel - how much bitcoin each party can send to the other.

questions.question: What is required to open a Lightning channel?

options.b: An on-chain Bitcoin transaction

questions.explanation: Opening a Lightning channel requires an on-chain Bitcoin transaction to lock funds into a multi-signature address shared by both parties.

questions.question: What happens when you close a Lightning channel?

options.b: An on-chain transaction distributes the final balances
options.d: Only one party gets their funds back

questions.explanation: Closing a channel triggers an on-chain transaction that distributes the final channel balances back to each party's Bitcoin addresses.

questions.question: What is a Lightning invoice?

options.a: A bill for Lightning Network services
options.b: A payment request containing amount and destination details

questions.explanation: A Lightning invoice is a payment request that contains the amount, destination, and other details needed to complete a Lightning payment.

questions.question: What is inbound liquidity in Lightning Network?

options.a: Your ability to receive Lightning payments
options.b: Your ability to send Lightning payments
options.c: The speed of your internet connection
options.d: The number of channels you have

questions.explanation: Inbound liquidity is the amount of bitcoin that others have on their side of channels with you, determining how much you can receive.

questions.question: What is a watchtower in Lightning Network?

options.a: A physical tower for Lightning infrastructure
options.b: A service that monitors channels for fraud attempts while you're offline

questions.explanation: Watchtowers monitor the blockchain for fraudulent channel closures and can broadcast penalty transactions to protect your funds when you're offline.

questions.question: What is the main scaling benefit of Lightning Network?

options.b: Thousands of payments per second with instant settlement

questions.explanation: Lightning enables thousands of instant payments per second off-chain, dramatically scaling Bitcoin's transaction capacity.

questions.question: What are Hash Time-Locked Contracts (HTLCs) used for in Lightning?

options.b: To enable secure multi-hop payments

questions.explanation: HTLCs enable atomic payments across multiple channels by ensuring all parts of a routed payment either succeed together or fail together.

questions.question: What is channel rebalancing?

options.b: Moving liquidity to optimize sending and receiving capacity

questions.explanation: Rebalancing moves funds between channels to optimize your ability to send and receive payments in different directions.

questions.question: What is submarine swapping?

options.a: Trading Lightning bitcoin for on-chain bitcoin
options.b: Moving funds between different Lightning wallets

questions.explanation: Submarine swaps allow trustless exchange between Lightning bitcoin and on-chain bitcoin without requiring channel operations.

questions.question: What is the Lightning Network's approach to privacy?

options.b: Better privacy than on-chain but not perfect

questions.explanation: Lightning provides better privacy than on-chain Bitcoin since payments don't appear on the public blockchain, but channel states and routing can still leak some information.

questions.question: What is a Lightning Address?

options.a: The IP address of a Lightning node
options.b: An email-like identifier for receiving Lightning payments
options.c: A Bitcoin address for Lightning channels
options.d: A physical mailing address for Lightning services

questions.explanation: Lightning Address is a protocol that allows users to receive Lightning payments using familiar email-like identifiers (user@domain.com).

questions.question: What are the main types of Lightning wallets?

options.b: Custodial and non-custodial wallets

questions.explanation: Lightning wallets are primarily categorized as custodial (service provider manages channels) or non-custodial (you manage your own channels and keys).

questions.question: What is force closing a Lightning channel?

options.a: Closing a channel immediately without the other party's cooperation
options.b: Closing multiple channels at once
options.c: Closing a channel with maximum fees

questions.explanation: Force closing broadcasts the latest channel state to the blockchain unilaterally, useful if the other party becomes unresponsive.

questions.question: What is the Lightning Network's solution to the micropayment problem?

options.b: It enables payments smaller than typical Bitcoin on-chain fees
options.d: It uses a different currency for small payments

questions.explanation: Lightning's low fees make it economical to send very small amounts that would be uneconomical on the Bitcoin base layer due to mining fees.

questions.question: What are the main trade-offs of using Lightning Network?

options.a: No trade-offs - it's better in every way
options.b: Speed and low fees vs. liquidity management and online requirements

questions.explanation: Lightning provides speed and low fees but requires managing channel liquidity and staying online, plus initial setup complexity compared to simple on-chain transactions.
